spoken_words: Hey, anybody mind if I serve as bartender? You know, I have a Ph.D in Mixology.
Hey, Homer! Care to try some of my Flanders Planters punch?
Au contraire, Simpson! It has three shots of rum, a jigger of bourbon and just little dab-a-roo of creme de cassis for flavor.
Why, Homer Simpson! Here to give your marriage a little spit shine?
Sometimes Maude, God bless her, she underlines passages in my Bible because she can't find hers.
Why Homer, you silly goose! The weed whacker's just for the edges! You're gonna be out here all day!

You are a picture and a half! Well -- hee hee! -- if you're finished by tomorrow, come on over and strap on the feed bag. We're gonna fire up old Propane Elaine and put the heat to the meat! Nummy nummy num!
Fee fi fo fum! I smell the potatoes au gratin of Marge Simp-son! Mmmm- mmm!
Friends, we love you all, but I also have a "sinister" motive for asking you all here -- "sinister" being Latin for "left-handed." But enough joking.
As of Friday, I'm saying toodle-oo to the pharmaceutical game.
No, I kid you not. Here's the noose I had to wear for ten years.

Well sir, like one out of every nine Americans, I'm left-handed. And let me tell you, it ain't all peaches and cream. Your writing gets smeared. Lord help you if you want to drive a standard transmission.
Well sir, I'm opening a one-stop store for Southpaws. Everything from left-handed apple peelers to left-handed zithers. I'm gonna call it the Leftorium.
So Homer, I'm dyin' to know. What do you think of the Leftorium?
Well, I know it's a little risky and it's gonna be a lot of hard work, but gosh darn it, it's gonna be a lot of fun, too.
You must have something you want to wish for, Homer.
Come on, Homer! I got an ambition to do some wishin'!
No, no, no, don't say. Otherwise it won't come true.
Oh, a little pokey, but things are gonna pick up.
Now, you put that money away. That was an accident.
N-Not yet. But one of the mall security guards took a good long look at a left-handed ice cream scoop.
Oh, oh, oh, I expect things to start picking up soon. I think word of mouth is startin' to spread.
Oh, right as rain. Or, as we say around here, left as rain.
Come on, Homer. Tell him about the store. I'm dyin' out here.
Are you sure you're not interested? Two hundred dollars is only the asking price.
Hey, I'm flexible! You don't have to pay all at once. I'll be here all night if you change your mind.
Oh, yeah. Sure. Thought I'd just get rid of some of the clutter. See anything you like?
Ah, got your eye on the gas grill. She's a butane beaut.
Twenty? Homer, I paid three hundred dollars for this just last year.
Well, there's no house to put it in, Homer, not since that nice fellow from the bank, who was only doing his job, came and locked it up.
Oh, oh, no, it's just a little campout tonight, then off to my sister's apartment in Capital City. Hey what do think, kids? The big city!
Say, Todd, I want to talk to your Uncle Homer. You're head of the car till I get back.
Listen to that singing... those poor fools. Homer, I'm ruined.
You know at times like these, I-I used to turn to the Bible and find solace. But even the good book can't help me now.
You know, ever since that barbecue, nothing's gone right. It's like there's been a-a curse on me.
No! You tried to warn me about gambling my family's future on some pig in a poke... I didn't listen. Homer, you were a true friend.
For two more days. Then it becomes Libertarian Party headquarters. I hope they have better luck than I did.
Homer, affordable tract housing made us neighbors. But you made us friends.
Hey, fellow slave, is that one of those monkey paw dealies that lets you wish for things?
Well, I guess my first wish is to get rid of those awful aliens.
Hey, Homer! This little thing-a-ma-jig really works great. Now that I've saved the earth, maybe I oughtta spruce up the ol' homestead.
Fella came into the store today and asked for change for a dollar. Well sir, I gave him three quarters by mistake. Took me the whole afternoon to track him down.
All right, that's it, young man. No Bible stories for you tonight.
Well, you knew I had a temper when you married me.
Sorry to bother you, Reverend Lovejoy, but I'm kind of in a tizzy. Our son Todd just told us he didn't want to eat his "damn vegetables."
No Reverend, the point is, he said a bad word.
He's not getting it from his brother, that's for darn sure.
I'm afraid I have a bone to pick with you.
No, I-I came to talk to you about your potty-mouth.
Look Homer, all of us pull a few boners now and then... go off half-cocked and make asses of ourselves. So, I don't want to be hard on you... but I just wish you wouldn't curse in front of my boys.
Okay, mister, you've got yourself a deal. I'll shave off the soup strainer, if you give the sailor talk the old heave-ho, okay?
Hey Homer, Ya know, I owe you one, buddy. No sooner had I shaved off the old cookie duster, than a lady cast me in a commercial.
Ah, I tell ya the way these checks keep coming in, it's almost criminal.
... So recycling is our way of giving Mother Earth a great big hug.
Aren't we in luck? Today's our tithe day and we've got ourselves a transient. Come in my friend. Let us feed and bathe you.
Well, if you ever want to spend the night, Maude and I can sleep on card tables.
Oh, indeedily-doodily. I've even been in "Streetcar" once before. I played Blanche DuBois! Hmmm huh. Just part of the fun of going to an all-male school.
Hot diggity! How 'bout that, Marge? Li'l ol' Stanley me! "Stella!" "Stella!" Heh heh.
Here, Marge, let me. Hate to be an armchair Blanche, but I always gave it one of these...
STELLA! STELLLA! CAN'T YOU HEAR ME YELL-A? / YOU'RE PUTTIN' ME THROUGH HELL-A / STELLA! STELLA!
The door's frozen shut... and it's the only way out!
Neighbor, I heard about your heresy and we've made it our mission to win you back to the flock.
Homer, Christian life isn't all praying and sacrifice. Hey, dig this.
Dear Lord, may your loving hand guide Homer to the mattress square and true.
Why, Sue Dokes, you rascal! I thought you were dead and--
Howdy-do, neighbor! Good pipe weather. Thought I'd fire up the briar.
Buenos dias, neighboritos. The handle's Flanders, but my friends call me Ned.
I just this minute bought it at the hardware st...
We'll take good care of your boy, Simpson. Enjoy the miracle of creation.
Oh Bart, you met Grandma Flanders. Hope she didn't scare ya.
Heidy-ho, Simpson. Your son shoved this through our doggie door.
And since we're returning your second born, do you think you could see your way to returning my TV tr...
Homer Simpson! Well, if that don't put the "dink" in co-inky-dink.
If I could give you my heart, Homer, I would.
Dear Lord, thank you for Ziggy comics, little baby ducks, and "Sweatin' to the Oldies," Volumes One, Two and Four.
IF YOU THINK I'M CUDDLY / AND YOU WANT MY COMPANY / COME ON WIFEY LET ME KNOW... UGH, UGH, UGH... OOOH...
It's been four thousand days since my last drink. It was my first and last Blackberry schnapps.
Hi-ho pagans! New Years was three months ago, but here's a present anyhoo!
I wish he were, Rod, I pray for the day, but I'm afraid he's just delirious from fever.
I can't imagine what we could've done to... Oh... oh no!
Oh...the network slogan is true. Watch Fox and be damned for all eternity.
Now, Marge, don't you worry. We've all had our brushes with the law.
Well, boys, who'd have thought learning about religion could be fun?
... 'cause the schools can't force you like they should.
Maude, these new finger-razors make hedge trimming as fun as sitting through church.
Uh-oh. Better cancel that dinner party tonight. Thanks for the nose-news, neighbor.
Aww, isn't that cute? He's trying to claw my eyes out.
Hey now, Marge. Let's not "should" this fella to death.
Well it's Bart Simpson! C'mon in! You're just in time for "Sponge Bath the Old Folks Day!"
Now, just breathe into him every three seconds. Make sure you form a tight seal around his mouth.
Well sir, just apply a smidgen of peanut butter to an ordinary pine cone and you got yourself a makeshift bird feeder, sir.
Oop, sorry, Bart, that's a Neddy no-no. You're not allowed to handle a pocketknife 'til you read this booklet on knife safety and pass a test.
Here you go, your rubber training knife. You've attained the rank of Pussy Willow.
Okay, kids, now I'm gonna teach you how to trap wild animals. But this should only be used in a life or death situation.
Okilly dokilly. Now, our annual Father-Son Rafting Trip is next weekend.
Oh Warren, I know your Dad is in prison, but don't you fret. A special Celebrity Dad has been arranged for ya.
Sorry, but I'm afraid Ernest Borgnine has already been confirmed.
Okey-dokey, everybody find a partner. Two dads to a raft.
Well, Homer, looks like we're boat buddies, huh? Want me to Zinc your sniffer?
I guess now we know why they call them rapids and not slow-pids, huh?
Now what happened to that gosh darn map I brought?
Again? Homer, we have to ration the water carefully. It's our only hope.
Wrong, we're saved! Sea gulls always stay near land. They only go out to sea to die.
Here's our chance! Dolphins always help humans lost at sea.
Come back! Come back! Oh, we're done for! We're done for! We're Done-diddily-done for we're done- diddily-doodily done-diddily-doodily done-diddily-doodily done-diddily-doodily...
You know, Homer, this cheese doodle is our last morsel of food.
That's what you're smelling, Homer! Oh, if it weren't for this blasted fog, we'd be saved!
Homer Simpson! That's a dilly of a pickle. Hey, let's conference you with Marge, huh?
You folks got robbed too? The burglar took my Shroud of Turin beach towels.
Welcome, neighbors... since the police can't seem to get off their dufferoonies to do something about this burglarino, I think it's time we start our own neighborhood watch... arooni!
I don't really have very much experience, but I'll be---
Oh golly, if that doesn't put the shaz in shazam. Oh listen, what's the cash value of those tickets so I can report it on my income tax?
Hidilly ho, neighbor. Wanna go to the game with me? I got two tic...
Well, get out the Crayolas and color me tickled pink! Oh, what's with the lead pipe? Were you gonna give my noggin a floggin'?
Stan, tell you what -- Homer Simpson here is just about the biggest Atom fan that's ever graced God's green earth. I bet he'd enjoy it, even more than me.
Ooo, I guess it's time for me to duck again.
Heydilly ho, window buddy. Just wonderin' if you'd like to come over and give the new pool table a whirl.
Uh, be careful there, Homer. That is sort of a new table.
Now, boys, Mr. Simpson is the guest. He gets to decide what to watch.
Sure didilly do. Over two hundred and thirty channels locked out.
Wait a second. You're the man at the hospital who reads to sick children.
...Bless the grocer for this wonderful meat, the middlemen who jacked up the price, and let's not forget the humane but determined boys over at the slaughter house.
Homer, I-I'd love to chitty-chat, but tonight's the night I do my charity work.
Homer, maybe you'd have had more fun at Moe's tonight.
Sometimes to keep from hurting someone's feelings, we have to say things that aren't exactly...
Eh, well sir. My entire family is very touched and--
We're headin' back. Todd's got Zesty Italian in his eye.
Oh Lord, please give me the strength to endure Homer Simpson's friendship.
There's Homer. There's Homer too. That's also Homer. That's Homer.
Ah, uh, Homer, we're gonna visit the boys' grandmother. Family only. You know?
I told you, officer. I'm not "hepped up" on "goof balls."
I can't do it, Maude. I can't face their accusing eyes.
Oh can't you see this man isn't a hero! He's annoying. He's very, very annoying!
Thank you. Thank you so much, Homer. You really are a you're a true friend.
Well, tippity-top o' the a.m. to every-good-body here! As chairman of the PTA, I Am dee-diddily-lighted to take over, and I think I can put the "pal" back in principal.
Now I know everybody's eager to get back to class --
But I thought it might break the ice if we had a little Q and A.
Well, let me just say I want to put the "stew" back in students.
Bart, I've barely been here a good solid week, and you've been sent to my office eleven times. And now that I have peanut butter cups, you seem to be gettin' in trouble every hour.
Anyhoo, Bart, you're gonna have to be punished. This isn't just some sort of club house.
Well, I may go a little bit easy on the old hickory dickory stick, but that's, that's because my dad was so hard on me when I was a boy.
Well, cockily-Doodily-Doo, little buddies. Let's thank the Lord for another beautiful school day.
Well, I really enjoyed my time here, Superintendent. May the Lord bless and keep you.
I wish there was some other explanation for this. But there isn't. I'm a murderer! I'm a murderer!
MARY HAD A LITTLE LAMB / LITTLE LAMB / LITTLE LAMB...
All right. It's true. I am a murderer. I over-watered Maude's favorite ficus plant, I panicked, and then I buried the remains. I was hoping to replace it before you got home.
Hey, why that sounds like Gabriel's trumpet. You know what that means, kids?
Oh, I see by the big board we've got a Negative Nellie in Sector Two. I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask the whole family to kinda freeze and prepare for re-Neducation.
Now, in case all that smilin' didn't cheer ya up, there's one thing that never fails. A nice glass of warm milk, a little nap, and a total frontal lobotomy.
I kinda figured this might happen, so I built the shelter big enough for both our families.
Well, Howdilly doodilly neighbors. Shouldn't you be in your sheltereenees by now?
I may regret this when our air runs out and we can't whistle or stay alive, but oh, what the hey...
Well sir, sounds fair. Toodle-oo, everybody. I'll, I'll scream when the comet gets here.
I might go mad with fear out there, so Todd, I want you to shoot Daddy if he tries to get back in.
QUE SERA, SERA / WHATEVER WILL BE, WILL BE / THE FUTURE'S NOT OURS TO SEE...
WHEN I WAS JUST A LITTLE GIRL / I ASKED MY MOTHER WHAT WILL I BE / WILL I BE PRETTY, WILL I BE RICH? / HERE'S WHAT SHE SAID TO ME...
Is that so? Well gee... maybe the old FlandersMobile could use a...
Lucky I always keep a Bible close to my heart.
Lucky I was wearing an extra large piece of the True Cross today. I think I'll go inside.
Now, Maude, in our movie, you lay baby Moses in the basket, then put it among the reeds. Okay? Lights, camera, act - diddily-doddily-doodilly- Action Jackson!
Flanders to God, Flanders to God! Get off your cloud and save my Todd.
"'Zounds" is a renaissance English word, short for "God's Wounds." But uh, "smite-ly," that's pure Flanders!
Oh, we sure could use a pooch to guard the flock at the Flanderosa.
All right, I'd like to call this meeting of the PTA to or-diddly-order and let's see if we can't put an end to this strike fuss, huh? Mrs. Krabappel, why don't you begin?
Well, I guess this is a case where we'll have to agree to disagree.
We do have an emergency plan in case of a prolonged strike right here.
Let's see. "Replace teachers with super-intelligent cyborgs. Or, if cyborgs aren't invented yet, use people from the neighborhood."
Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in... Oh my Lord!! Something horrible has happened!
Well, I guess I am putting up the Halloweenie decorations a little early. Criticism accepted.
Okay, okay folks, look. I called the Police Captain in Shelbyville. He says he hasn't seen our kids, but if they show up in the morgue he's gonna fax us.
Well, okay, but, you know, just go a little bit easy on the...
Well, a friendly Springfield hello there, neighbors. I, you know, we think some kids of ours may be missing in your town.
Mmm-hmm. All we want to do is give you kids a good home until they get their act together.
Oh, Bart. I know you're still getting adjusted here. Tell you what. We'll do whatever you want to do.
Well, I guess a little television won't hurt. I used to let the boys watch "My Three Sons," but it got 'em all worked up before bedtime.
C'mon, you Gloomy Gusses. Who's up for a big bowl of non-fat ice milk?
WELL, I DON'T KNOW IF THE ALLEGATIONS ARE TRUE / BUT YOU GOT US, AND BABY, WE GOT YOU.
Well, children, it's Saturday night, so what say we let our hair down and play Bombardment...
Okay. For one gold star: What Persian king exempted the Levites from taxation?
No, Son, we've got to let Bart and Lisa get one. C'mon, this one's easy.
Well, guess! Book of Revelations... Fire-breathing lion's head... tail made out of snakes... Who else is it gonna be?!
Jes... ? Jes... ? Don't you kids know anything? The serpent of Rehaboam? The well of Zohassadar? The bridal feast of Beth Chadruharazzeb?
Reverend... Emergency... I... You... Simpson kids... Eedily... Baptism... Oodily... Doodily-doodily...
Until this, I never thought Homer and Marge were bad parents. But now I know you kids need a less hellbound family.
Today we write a new page in the Flanders family bible.
Who wants to be the first to enter God's good graces?
Rod, you order anything you want for your big ten-oh.
Well, I expect that type of language at Denny's, but not here.
Oh, gosh, Homer, this is strictly a Flanders affair. I've got family here from around the globe! Here's JosÃ© Flanders...
Congratulations, Homer. Your Q is a huge success. A toast to the host who can boast the most roast.
Well, as the tree said to the lumberjack -- I'm stumped.
Yeah. A crazy guy shot a bunch of people and the subway ran over my hat.
You have our deepest condol-diddly-olences. I'm sorry. I'm just nervous, I didn't mean any disrespect.
Oh, Marge. Of course Homer's alive. He's alive in all our hearts.
So if you're looking for a half bag of charcoal briquettes, or an artificial Christmas tree -- trunk only, c'mon over to the Hibbert table. Pronto.
Well sir, looks like we got some nice items here at Table Glick. Like this...
Uh-huh. Well, I... uh, I guess you could put a lot of nice things in there--
Now, folks, nothin' spells fun like rhinestones on a dungaree jacket!
Well, sir, I'm welcoming the Bushes on behalf of the Neighborhood Association.
Howdily-Doodily there, President Bush--or should I say President Neighbor! I'm Ned Flanders, and this is Maude, Rod and Todd.
Thankily-dank, Mayor, I shan't disappoint. Har ye, har ye! I declare myself pickled tink about Springfield's Bicen-ciddily-ti-ten-toodily-rin-tin-tennial Day!
Aw, they're just family heirlooms. That shouldn't stand in the way of Homer takin' my job and--
Howdy, Reverend Lovejoy. Nice to see you there ... on my lawn... with your dog.
Better get the ol' snow shovel back from Homer, huh?
Why don't you freeze it with an ice cube and hit it with a hammer? Works for me when I get bubbly-gum in the ol' push-broom.
Hmm. I seem to have mashed more hair into it. Oh well.
Well, howdilly-doodily, stranger! Couldn't help but notice you stealing my boat.
Ooh, sounds spine-tingly-dingling. Just promise you'll have a good time.
Maude? Boys? Come on up! We're gonna have a little camp-out in the dinghy.
Open the door, Maude! I don't have time for the secret knock!
Well, now realistically, Homer, I've lived here some 30-odd years. This is the first and only bear I've ever seen.

Homer, I'm in a rhubarb of a pickle of a jam here. I was all set to go off on vacation, when I get called up for jury duty. Oh, it's a corker of a case -- seems a man drove up onto a traffic island and hit a decorative rowboat full of geraniums.
Well, if it'll seal the deal, I'll take a look at your septic tank. See if I can get her hummin' again.

Uh... Homer... Ah, about those things you borrowed from me over the years -- you know -- the TV trays, the power sander, that downstairs bathtub... you going to be needing those things in Cypress Creek?
Well, if God didn't make little green apples -- it's Homer Simpson! How long have you been here?
Oh, suckin' down the cider, eh? Hey, word to the wise... season pass!
Pays for itself after the 16th visit. You know, most people don't know the difference between apple cider and apple juice. But I do. Now here's a little trick to help you remember...
If it's clear and yellow, you've got juice there, fellow! If it's tangy and brown, you're in Cider Town! Now there's two exceptions, and it gets kinda tricky here...
...Adirondack cider can be yellow if they're using late-season apples. And, of course, in Canada the whole thing's flip-flopped...

Homer, I'm as permissive as the next parent. I mean, just yesterday, I let Todd buy some Red Hots with a cartoon devil on the box. But you can't possibly think it's appropriate for your ten-year-old son to work in a burlesque house!
Uh, it's an angry mob, ma'am. Could you step outside for a twinkle while we knock down your house?
I'm sorry, it really was one of those spur-of-the-moment-type things.
Y'know, I like his films, except for that nervous fella who's always in 'em.
Well, need some help there? You know, maybe you folks should come over and hunker in our bunker.
Oh, it'll be fun. We're gonna go through our old cancelled checks and receipts and give ourselves an audit. Make sure we don't owe anything extra.
Okilly-dokilly. Oo, I better go take down the manger scene. If baby Jesus got loose, he could really do some damage.
Well, sir, everyone's alive. Guess that's something to be thankful for.
Y'know, it's kinda funny. The only thing that survived the storm were the family tombstones. They're all we have left.
Reverend Lovejoy, with all that's happened to us today -- Uh, I... I kinda feel like Job.
But Reverend, I need to know. Is God punishing me?
Even in my darkest hour, I can turn to the Good Book for...

Why me, Lord? Where have I gone wrong? I've always been nice to people. I don't drink or dance or swear. I've even kept kosher, just to be on the safe side. I've done everything the Bible says, even the stuff that contradicts the other stuff. What more could I do? I... I feel like I'm coming apart here. I want to yell out, but I... I... I just can't dang-diddily-do-dang-do-don-diddily-darn-do it. I... I...I...
It's wonderful. I... I... I don't know how I can possibly repay you, but if any of you ever need a favor, just look for the happiest man in Springfield.
Was that... uh, was that toilet always next to the refrigerator?

Oh, now, calm down Neddilly-diddily-diddily-diddily-diddily... They did their best... Shoddily-iddily-iddily-diddily... Gotta be nice... hostility-ilitity-bility-dility -- Aw, hell, diddly-ding-dong-crap! Can't you morons do anything right?!!
Well, my family and I can't live in good intentions, Marge! Oh, your family is out of control, but we can't blame you, because you have goooood intentions.
Oh, okay "Dude." I wouldn't want you to have a cow, "Man." Here's a catch-phrase you better learn for your adult years: "Hey, buddy, got a quarter?"
Do I hear the sound of butting in? It's gotta be little Lisa Simpson -- Springfield's answer to a question no one asked!
What do we have here? The long, flabby arm of the law. The last case you got to the bottom of was a case of Mallomars.
Oh yeah, the clown. The only one of you buffoons who doesn't make me laugh. And as for you -- I don't know you, but I'm sure you're a jerk.
Homer, you are the worst human being I have ever met.
I attacked all my friends and neighbors just for trying to help me. I'd like to commit myself.
Uh, actually, I'm a little chilly. Could I have another straitjacket?
Oh, well, I'll just have to try harder! Oops, thanks for dropping by.
Oh, they hum like angels. You're never lonely if you've got a fluorescent light.

No, that's not true. I... I... I don't like the service at the post office. Y'know, it's all rush, rush, get you in, get you out. Then, they've got those machines in the lobby. They're even faster. No help there. You might even say I hate the post office. That, and my parents. Lousy beatniks! Hey, that felt good!
Thanks, everyone. I'm all better now. No more storing up the anger 'til I explode. If any of you does something I don't like, you are gonna hear about it!
And if you really tick me off, I'm gonna run you down with my car!
Oh, I admit it! It's only two-alarm -- two-and-a-half tops! I just wanted to be a big man in front of the kids.
Uh, were you on my roof last night, stealing my weathervane?
THEY'RE NOT PERFECT, BUT THE LORD SAYS LOVE THY NEIGHBOR --
Homer, I can honestly say that was the best episode of Impy and Chimpy I've ever seen.

Homer, I've got a fozzie of a bear of a problem. Y'know, Maude and her mother were visiting Tyre and Sidon, the twin cities of the Holy Land. They must've kneeled in the wrong place and prayed to the wrong God, because, well, they're being held prisoner by militants of some sort.
Well, any hoodily-doodle, the embassy says it's just a routine hostage-taking -- but I have to drive to Capital City, fill out some forms to get 'em out. Could you possibly watch the kids tonight?
Well, I don't know, Lisa. You're awfully young, and the boys can be a handful. Todd's been pinching everyone lately.
Well, what do you say, Homer? Can Lisa babysit for my kids?
Oh, imagine that -- sleeping quietly after a bug attack! Oh, and Todd's as dry as a bone! Lisa, you're a wonder! I'm going to recommend you to everybody!
You did? Just a minute. What time can you come over?
Well, if you're talking about root beer, I plead guilt-didilly-ilty as char-dardilly-arged.
I'm meek... but I could probably stand to be meeker.
...Well, I... I think I may be coveting my own wife...
Uh, I'm in some hot soup here, Marge. Uh, some teenagers are hanging out in front of the store. I... I think they could start slacking at any moment.
Uh, excuse me, fellas... I... I couldn't help thinking it might be nice if you could uh, vamoose, you know. If possible.
Uh, Marge, I... I appreciate your advice, but, uh, things have gotten... Well, they... they're a lot worse.
Yeah, it's Ned Flanders. The teens have been chasing me all night. They finally stopped to gas up their scooters.
Oh, I can't see the name of the station... but the gas costs one forty-nine and eight tenths.
Tell Maude I want a fancy funeral. Big coffin. Lotsa jewels.
You saved me, Reverend. You really went above and beyond. Thank you!
Well, sir, I hate to be a Suspicious Aloysius on you, but did you steal my air conditioner?
Ex... ex... excuse me, sir? I think you've got my TV. Sir?
Ho-ho-ho, you betcha. Team sports'll keep you away from temptations like rock music and girls.
Little higher, Wendell... A lot higher, Martin... Ah, Ralph, that's a basketball.
Well, that's super-duper, Lisa! In fact, we already have four girls on the team.
All right, Wildcats! Are you ready to give 110 per cent, take it one game at a time, and go the whole nine yards?
Do you have a problem with the way I'm coaching?
Uh-huh. Half a brain, huh? Well, you know what? It sounds like you just volunteered!
Oh-ho, I gotta say, Lisa, it sounds like you're strainin' to do some explainin'.
Oh, we can work this out, friends. In the spirit of sharing, what say we simply place the sacred bones in--
Hey-hey there, Marge. Just brought the kids over to share a prayer with the blessed angel, if it's okay with you.
Science is like a blabbermouth who ruins a movie by telling you how it ends. Well, I say there are some things we don't want to know! Important things!
We've come for the angel, Homer. It's not safe with the unbeliever.
Reverend, I've got to admit, this doomsday warning has me just a smidge twitterpated.
Well, shall we sing a hymn? Uh, "Nearer My God to Thee", maybe? Or, or, or "Amazing Grace"?
Well, nothing's perfect, I sure hate to make you come out here and not buy a house.
